subject: Productivity
title: Eat the Frog
description: A quick, practical guide to Eat the Frog.

hook.text: Mark Twain supposedly said: eat a live frog first thing in the morning and nothing worse will happen.

buildup.text: Brian Tracy turned that quote into a productivity system. Do your hardest task first each day.

discovery.text: Willpower peaks in the morning for most people. Tackling the hard task early uses that energy wisely.

twist.text: Most people do the opposite. They warm up with easy tasks and run out of energy before the big one.

climax.text: The frog method isn't about suffering. It's about matching your hardest work to your strongest hours.

punchline.text: Do the hard thing first. The rest feels easy.

quiz.question: What is the core principle of the Eat the Frog method?
options: Do your hardest task first each day
Break every task into tiny pieces
Only work on tasks you enjoy
